website_summaries.verdict: A mesmerizing in-water sensory tool that keeps kids occupied for long stretches of time – parents should supervise, however, because of their size.
pros: Store easily before use, and quickly expand to several times their original size when soaked in water
Can be rehydrated multiple times, and do not burst easily
cons: Eventually will burst with enough play or rehydration
Difficult to clean up if spilled
Some find them too small, even after hydration
Small enough to swallow if kids are unsupervised

customer_reviews.title: Smaller size than expected
customer_reviews.text: We already have some small water beads and I was looking for a larger size to add some variety to my daughters sensory bin. As pictured these would have been perfect. However 80% of the water beads are much smaller than expected based on the picture. If you want water beads and don't care about the size, then these are fine. But if you want beads the size as shown in the picture, then these aren't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Lovesdogs2

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughters love them! They are so smooth, refreshing to the touch and skin, and fragrance-free! I recommend them. Just a tip before you let your children play with them: I rinsed them well as a few of them broke apart while processing and the broken pieces become very mushy/slimy. I followed the soaking directions on the package. Also note: the bag I received were bold colors; however, they processed light colored; not as photo; perhaps it was the chemicals in my tap water?They were full-sized at about 4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Janice B.

customer_reviews.title: Not Safe for Toddlers False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions on the package and soak d the beads for 24 hours 1 tablespoonful for beads in 1 gallon of water. My toddler and I put our hands in the hydrated beads and the started to fall apart. The break incredibly easily once hydrated and the beads that did not break have cracks forming so I anticipate those will fall apart soon. The description stat s they are “reusable” and “safe for toddlers” it’s a load of crap they fall apart after one minute of use and break into small pieces that are definitely unsafe for toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: hillary matthews

customer_reviews.title: SPD
customer_reviews.text: Sensory beads were in stock and delivered quick. Beads didn't get as big as some of the pictures shown. Ours reached dime size even after left in water over night. However my son loved them just the same. He hates to touch anything wet or slimy feeling but he LOVED these beads. He put his hands, his feet and wanted to pour them on top of his head! I can't believe he enjoys the cold and squishy feeling. great product! I'm sure this is helping his SPD (sensory processing disorder).
customer_reviews.author: Andra Slider

customer_reviews.title: My almost 2 year old did not like these at all
customer_reviews.text: My almost 2 year old did not like these at all. He was intrigued enough to touch them a few times, but he didn't like the slimy feeling. I, on the other hand, love the way it feels. I'm hoping he'll warm up to them over time. One issue we had with them is that a lot of the beads were broken or crumbly, so when we'd remove our hands we'd have pieces of gel stuck all over. I think this is why my toddler disliked them, as he HATES when his hands are dirty.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyTop Contributor: Children's Books

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how I feel about these.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a child with autism and a sensory disorder. At first, he was a little hesitant about touching them. Then when he did start handling them, they would break in two so they're not like squishy balls that stay together. They come in vivid colors and if they wouldn't break apart, I'd love them.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Tester

customer_reviews.title: Huge Hit In Our House
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to use, make and store. My son (18 months) LOVES playing with them. So much so that a meltdown follows us picking them up and putting them away. I gave it a four because it does claim that they do not break easily. However, my son can squeeze them between his finger and they break. Also, if I put my hands in them my fingernails cut in to them rather easily. This isn't hugely upsetting though since we get 20,000 of them AND you can rehydrate the ones you've been playing with.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: SO GREAT! Be sure to use distilled water to hydrate these. They weren’t kidding about that! Regular water makes the beads smell musty after a few days and the smell just doesn’t go away. However, with distilled water, they’re so fun!! They hold up very well and won’t smush even when handled by exuberant little hands. They stay hydrated for a long time, even without a lid. My nephew loved them when he came to visit and I’ve loved them ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Read post!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in loveeeeee. These things are my children's favorite! I have a 2 year old and a 6 year old and they keep them occupied forever..my 6 year old had adhd and he actually sat down to play with these. It was like his mind wasn't going 100 mph like it normally is. I'm really surprised how much I like the beads. They're awesome and we will definitely be buying again once the 20,000 we bought first runs out lol HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Gasper

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I am using the water beads for calming bottles in my art studio classroom. I actually took a bunch of them to opening meetings where I found myself watching the calming bottle, as I felt my stress levels begin to rise. Colleagues also enjoyed the mesmerizing effects. So far, the beads have held up for the past three weeks submerged both in a glue/water and baby oil/water mixture. I made 4 bottles using approx. 1 T. from the 1 pack of beads and still have most of the package left to make more. Make note, that the colors are quite light compared to the original colors of the dry beads.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: LOVED
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves the water beads. We had ordered from someone else a few weeks prior and within one night they were mooshy and gross and we had to throw them out. We ordered these ones and they arrived fast which she was super excited about. I was a little nervous because the package was so small but it made just as many water beads as the other package and they have lasted days so far without getting all mooshy and gross and my daughter absolutely LOVES them!! We will definitely be ordering them again when the time comes!
customer_reviews.author: Chandra

customer_reviews.title: They fall apart/crumble
customer_reviews.text: My kids love the regular size water beads so I thought it would be fun to try these large ones. We put them in water in the morning. By mid afternoon they looked interesting, but hadn’t expanded to round balls yet. We left them overnight. In the morning we went to play with them but quickly learned they are too delicate to handle, they easily fell apart from normal kid handling, while none of our normal size water beads did. It was still fun, but I wish they were a stronger material like the small beads seem to be.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra S.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good toy for any child. (Might be a better florist accessory)
customer_reviews.text: Beads are very pastel once expanded, and they are much smaller than shown in images. Package is not resealable. If left in water too long the beads fall apart, and it’s like trying to pickup a glob if jello. Not recommended for indoor play. Not recommended for children unless you want them to be frustrated and cry.
customer_reviews.author: PattiKS

customer_reviews.title: Small water beads-NOT as pictured!
customer_reviews.text: False representation of what you will get. I ordered these because I I wanted bigger ones than what I already had and they were all very small at their “largest”. Not happy with the photos presented, also people have posted pics of their beads and we may all be getting something different each time as my beads did not look at all the same as what others have posted here. Keep looking!
customer_reviews.author: Family Account

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the colors.
customer_reviews.text: The photo did not show black, white and clear beads. I was really disappointed when I put them in water and in a few hours I received more black, white and clear beads than other colors. Also, there are hardly any blue and green. My batch was mostly black, white, clear, yellow and orange. Really disappointed as I am using these in a few days. Picture shown is not what I received as far as the colors go. However, they seem to hold up really well and they don't burst easily.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: These beads are so cool. I gave my daughters each a big bowl ...
customer_reviews.text: These beads are so cool. I gave my daughters each a big bowl and split a gallon of distilled water and 1/2 tsp of each of the beads. You can definitely use more beads than 1/2 tsp but I was following instructions. The beads turn marble size over night. My girls were amazed with the feel and colors and how they grew in size. Quite a few broke but not a big deal since you get so many. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Fun for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my two grandchildren as a surprise during the pandemic lockdown. I thought their parents could use a distraction! I wasn’t exactly sure what they would be like, but they were a HUGE hit! They absolutely loved them and so did their parents. I would absolutely order these again!
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Morian

customer_reviews.title: Use distilled water if you want them to look like the picture.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions but the beads were not very big at all. I read another review that mentioned using distilled water, so I bought some and it did affect the size! The beads on the left were in distilled water where as regular on the right. (We have a water softener so maybe it affected it?). Also, a lot of the beads fell apart which I didn't find too safe for children who put things in their mouths. Good value for what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: vjkimmel

customer_reviews.title: ... issue I have with them is how quickly and easily the clear ones (and only the clear ones) seem ...
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have with them is how quickly and easily the clear ones (and only the clear ones) seem to disintegrate into mush. My toddler had a blast playing with them though, and I'll probably make a ton for her birthday party....
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: False ad...smaller than pictured...
customer_reviews.text: The first photo made it look like it was large... But after soaking these for 12 hours, they are the same size when it was 1 hour soaked. Since I've gotten water beeds from elsewhere, I know this is just the regular size. And after letting them sit in the water, I definitely know they are regular size. Disappointed because we already have a ton of these regular ones for a better price.... Now we're stuck with these. Do not buy if you're expecting large ones.
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old loves these!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these after my Occupational Therapist sister recommended them as great sensory play. My son will play with these FOR HOURS!! Just remember to watch your young children with these because they are small enough to be swallowed and if they bite into them they do break into little pieces. We play with them in a lasagna dish to help contain the little buggers!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart easy
customer_reviews.text: We didn't line that they fell apart just by sticking your hands in them. Also my kids didn't really know what to do with them... In part because they fell apart so easily that they really couldn't play with them. Maybe I just don't know what that are for? But the kids aren't rough.
customer_reviews.author: breeze

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: We really didn’t like these at all. We used them once before they got SO slimy and gross that they were no longer usable. Yes, I followed the instructions. We tried three separate times and they all got really gross and slimy. I tried to rinse them and dry them out and re-do it, but they would never dry out and they would break apart. These attracted me for the price but I really don’t think it’s worth it if I have to throw them out after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves to put her hands in these and play with them for about 30 minutes. It only takes a tablespoon to make a gallon of these and you get about a cup of them in the package. I don't know how to dry them back out, and they sat around for awhile and started smelling funky. They got tossed into my potted plants. I think it would be really smart to put these in potted plants! Especially hydroponic ones so you can see them.
customer_reviews.author: Harmony Lowry

customer_reviews.title: Fun sensory toy
customer_reviews.text: Got the rainbow large balls and small rainbow balls. Filled the bathtub half full of water, poured in half of both sizes of balls. Then tried to patiently wait for my 3 and 7 year old grandkids to come over the next evening. The kids loved the water balls! The adults loved them too. Quite the sensory experience! When everyone leaves, I'm going to add some hot water to the bath and play with these myself!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but
customer_reviews.text: So these were easy to use.. but as someone with milk OCD, they're bouncy, so they get EVERYWHERE. Under the grill, the street, under the car, crevices... *shudders.*. They also do NOT dehydrate as fast as everyone says. If you are a very chill person, these are for you. If you're like me, save yourself the stress. Side note: I picked out all of the black and white ones, which looked like fish eggs, yuck. The pike was much prettier after that.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Apter

customer_reviews.title: About the size of a pea
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the images from the brand and in the reviews, thinking they were closer to the size of a marble. We even left them in the water for 2 days to be sure, but they are indeed the standard small size, about the size of a pea -- just slightly bigger. They are still fun to play with. Just wanted some bigger ones.
customer_reviews.author: ajb86

customer_reviews.title: So fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 3 & 5 year old love these water beads. They hydrated in a few hours and kids played on and off for hours. You only need a 1-2 tablespoons to make a lot of beads. Great to keep kids entertained for long periods of time. Recommend using a container with higher sides so beads don’t spill everywhere. Very slippery, great colors.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: They all grew the same size, very small, smaller than an aspirin after 36 hours soaking (thought they'd get bigger with time, but no). Picture is very deceiving which is why I decided on them. Dry beads were the size of sand grains.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Messy, easy to break
customer_reviews.text: How do I started? I was not impressed with the quality of the beads, it takes time to absorb water (over 24 hours) it does not have bright colors, mostly transparent or just translucent. It breaks easily thus,it is such a mess for our sensory play. Because it break easily, it is messy and hard to clean, I have to let it dry to vacum which can takes several days. Not satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Mila M

customer_reviews.title: Great Sensory Toy
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I love these! We played for them for the first time today, adding some small toys to the mix for a texture change. I nearly had to wrestle them away when it was done. I'm not sure if the kids are popping them or if they simply burst that easily but there are plenty in the package and still left from what I made initially that it will be awhile before they run out anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Gould

customer_reviews.title: SO ADDICTIVE
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I got this for one son of mine in particular, the one who can't keep his hands off of everything he sees and is highly attracted to feeling things that feel squishy and bumpy and such. And he instantly fell in love. But so did all of us! If you walk by these pretty little balls, you really can't resist. We've had 4 kids gathered around it at one time, just feeding their sensory appetite. Just wish they didn't go bouncing everywhere so easily. But you know...life is messy.
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: Oh What Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are sensational ! I got them for my great granddaughter but I think I have as much fun with them as she does. The experience of hydrating them is even fun, watching them grow. I haven't figured out yet what all we can do with them, but for now we are having a ball just handling, sorting, scooping them. So glad I found them. Her water table leaked so we filled it with the beads. Oh what fun!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Wohlfeil

customer_reviews.title: Not as bright/jeweled colored, more pastel but fun
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun; colors are not as vibrant as in product image. More pastel colored. Also, beads are on the small size even after 48 hrs of soaking - imagine slightly larger than a skittles candy, rounded. Purchased for 3yr old being watched like a hawk to avoid eating/in ears/in nose mishaps. But safe, no odor or smell, and theyre lots of fun as expected.
customer_reviews.author: IBuyWhatILike

customer_reviews.title: I think he finds them very soothing and I love how good they are for his fine motor skills
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves these!! I think he finds them very soothing and I love how good they are for his fine motor skills!! The only thing I wish I would have paid more attention to is the time it takes to grow. After 4 hours they are a good size but best at 24. I love that I can store and re use them!
customer_reviews.author: Boymama2018

customer_reviews.title: TINY bag - beads don’t expand much
customer_reviews.text: Wayyy smaller than the pictures make them look. I’ve bought a different brand that actually got big like the pics. These ones were super small. Very disappointed. ALSO you can buy a better product that gives you way way more beads. For the same price you can practically get a pint or more and you get a tiny bag of these.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy Lent

customer_reviews.title: Made it into a science experiment!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son loves math and science and loved watching these grow, then we measured out the the growth - 1 tsp turns into 1 quart, water goes from 4 quarts to 3 quarts. I bought these for bath play time now that he has to bathe after every day at daycare with the new COVID measures and he's looking forward to it!
customer_reviews.author: CO Girl

customer_reviews.title: great fun
customer_reviews.text: bit disappointed with how easily the beads break up (sort of like the insides of a diaper!) but my daughter has had such fun with these, just can't dry and re-use like some reviewers had suggested two year-old. she not have autism i just got them for a good play toy and they keep her occupied for hours on end and it's so much tidier than playing with a bucket of water inside (winter..) like she had been before i got these!
customer_reviews.author: Illinois1

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if they're eco friendly
customer_reviews.text: These may work for those looking to put in a bowl and play with but what happens when they go down the drain? Our son accidentally dumped a cup full of these into the bathtub and now the water in the tub drains slowly. Not the product's fault that they don't break down but still not really kid or environment friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Waqas Saeed

customer_reviews.title: Follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these twice now. Last time I made the mistake of putting them in my kid's wading pool and they exploded from oversaturation. Whoops! This time, I followed the instructions and bought a 32 quart container to hold them all. Kiddo has had a blast playing in the "jelly beads" and was enthralled watching them get bigger and bigger. Even I have fun playing in them too!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Dull & Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly disappointed to discover that these water beads aren’t nearly as vibrant as the picture appears. After letting them soak, the beads were surprisingly dull and boring. When placed in water again, some fade away until you can barely tell anything’s there. Now I’m left with a giant bag of worthless beads. Won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Molsdee

customer_reviews.title: The beads break apart so easily, even just picking them up if you have ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for— these beads disintegrated in no time. After one day of playing with them, I have a big globby mess. The beads break apart so easily, even just picking them up if you have fingernails, the beads break apart when they hit your nails. Super disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bama Boy 70

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time experimenting with water beads. The directions stated one teaspoon to one gallon of water. I later learned that the estimate was somewhat off. It's more like three teaspoons to one gallon. The beads completely developed in about 11 hours. Great for sensory diets. The beads were an assortment of beautiful colors. Really fun to play with.
customer_reviews.author: NSA80

customer_reviews.title: My son has SPD and his OT recommend more sensory play at home
customer_reviews.text: My son has SPD and his OT recommend more sensory play at home, in the beginning he disliked touching these wet gooey beads, now he request to play with the bin full of them at least 3 times a day!! The packet is so small but half of it filled a good large size tupperware tub. We are looking to order more and fill a plastic kiddie size pool since he seems to want to now dive into the bin!
customer_reviews.author: Jeneen

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensory play
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for my niece who is special needs. She is blind and deaf. She hates the heat! These stay nice and cold and she loves them!
customer_reviews.author: FortuneFarm

customer_reviews.title: Magic!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how they make the magic happen, but it's amazing to watch. 24 hours after soaking tiny beads in distilled water, there are these slick gelatinous balls that appear to be mere shadows of color in a jar with water, tangible (good feeling) pretty balls in our hands. Baffling science and sensory pleasure all at once.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Crow

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty and fun
customer_reviews.text: My kids had so much fun with these. They are slightly smaller than a marble and took about 4 hours to soak to size. Was fun for the kids to keep checking in on the growth and then fun for them to play with! There are so many things that can be done with them! The colors were vibrant and beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: These beads are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These beads are the coolest! I bought them for my son for fun sensory activities and he has had a blast playing with them. He has some disabilities so sensory input is important and these beads did the job! Warm water helps the beads expand faster and there is enough in the little package to make about four gallons of beads. Good for a sensory bath! I bought a second package and will continue to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Julieanna W.

customer_reviews.title: This small package makes a lot of water beads!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loved playing with these. She liked everything from watching them grow bigger, to the colorful colors, and just playing with them. We have only used a couple Tablespoons of it which makes PLENTY so the total amount that comes in the package will last us quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: These beads provide hours of fun for my twins! From the moment we put them in water they are looking at the beads grow, noticing the colors, feeling the texture. To me, the best part is the they are non-toxic and reusable since your can let them dehydrate and they shrink back! I will purchase some more to gift to my nephews and nieces that live overseas as I am sure they will be a hit with them too!
customer_reviews.author: Daniella D

customer_reviews.title: Same as an Orbie.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, but was a little disappointed in that I thought they would be twice as big as an Orbie. These are the same thing as an Orbie. They do work great, just thought they would be bigger after getting wet. They are fun to play with.
customer_reviews.author: texaslady

customer_reviews.title: Good but for outside (not bathtub
customer_reviews.text: My daughters (4, 7) liked these - fun to play with. Warning - do NOT put in bathtub ... poured some in and had to keep water overnight to let them grow to be able to remove so they wouldn’t go down drain and clog pipes :(
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Westen

customer_reviews.title: Not as large as pictured
customer_reviews.text: These are great but the picture is misleading. These do not get as big as they are in the photo. They are about the size of cherry pits when they are full sized. Just know that when you purchase. Otherwise they are great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used these I thought they were fun and a cool sensory activity. The second time we used them my deck and driveway were destroyed! They bounce all over the place when they spill. Cleaning them up is near impossible!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is way much smaller than what advertised
customer_reviews.text: The balls are too small compared to what in the images. most likely they use a baby hands to trick customer minds that it has a large shape. shame on you.
customer_reviews.author: Marzo

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product! When I received them, I didn't read the description thoroughly at first and when I saw a bunch of tiny beads, I was skeptical. I followed the instructions to soak them overnight, and when I awoke the next morning, I was extremely surprised and pleased to find they were exactly as pictured! My son loves these sensory beads, and I don't have to worry about him squeezing and breaking them because I have so much extra.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: These are a welcome sensory break for my suddenly-homeschooling kids. Very satisfying to touch and play with. My only disappointment is that the photo is very misleading; they're much smaller than depicted.
customer_reviews.author: LucieBlue

customer_reviews.title: These are Cool
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to make cooling neck bands. One-half teaspoon of the tiny beads (before soaking in water) ended up filling a quart container after they had soaked. Nice they're non-toxic, because they are attractive to little kids.
customer_reviews.author: Loki

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our sensory bin for our kids and they love it they love squishing it and playing with it and even watching them as they absorb the water..... Like seriously sat there and watched it happen lol thanks for the memories
customer_reviews.author: Damaris Mendez

customer_reviews.title: definitely your moneys worth here!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These were absolutely perfect for my 3yr old. He was dumping out everything from my kitchen,,, like flour sugar, salt, nesquick, ETC So i thought if I bought something he could pour from one container to the next, he might stay out of MY stuff. And it's working so far! This makes a TON of beads. Very much worth the money! I bought this one just because the average review was over four stars. I'm not disappointed!!!!
customer_reviews.author: amber c

customer_reviews.title: these are cute but
customer_reviews.text: I bought for young children to play in the water with. DONT. These are small and every little child is going to put it in their mouth. They do work well for flower vases and weddings but don't get them for young children
customer_reviews.author: Misty OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Such a blast for kids (and adults!!)!!
customer_reviews.text: Soo much fun!! Hours of fun!!! I highly recommend these! You only use a tiny bit at a time, so you can make many big batches!! I would definitely recommend these for kids kindergarten and older!!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: OTA approved!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order of water beads, the first order I got someplace else. My students were able to squeeze and break about half the beads the first 2 days they were in use. The new Sensory Jungle beads are much sturdier! Day 3 and I have only seen a few that were broken, with effort by my students mind you! I'd say more than 95% are not breakable! Two thumbs up from this OTA!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Pen

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! The amount for price is amazing. The concept in general is cool- such tiny beads turn into dime size soft blobs. Both my kids enjoy them but they're a perfect sensory toy for my SPD kiddo. They're also great in sensory bottles. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Frederika K.

customer_reviews.title: Proper container and area for inside play.
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for my 2 year old grandaughter who has a sensory issue. I was a little disappointed by their size, from the picture they looked bigger, also it said the size of a marble, but they are smaller than that. On a good note, my grandaughter loved them and played with them for over 20 minutes, then started to throw them at the dog and we took them away. (PS-the adults loved them also) We just have to figure the right container and area for her to play with them, too cold to do outside.
customer_reviews.author: Marguerite M.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than pictured
customer_reviews.text: Great fun, but the beads do not get as big as the picture shows. Still worth it, we’ve had fun Thoth only a small bit of the package used. I put the extra in an empty spice jar to use later without spilling them.
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: Water beads are so fun!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, it was delivered quickly and was exactly what I expected. They are so fun and I used them for Halloween to put my candy in, so the trick or treaters got a little trick while reaching in for their treat!! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: josh mauller

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool
customer_reviews.text: They original come in the form of little tiny pellets, just add water, wait 16-24 hours, and boom!!! They turn into marbles. They work great, my toddlers loves them in the bath, totally safe, no mess.
customer_reviews.author: ALEX G.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: These are so great. Hours of entertainment. And it's a great value. I only used just a little bit of beads and wound up with a whole tub full of squishy balls! All those balls and I still have most of the package of beads left over for later!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Marshall

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had read the reviews before purchasing. The colors are not at all like the pictures & the size is dramatically different than what is advertised. We will still use them, but this isn’t what I thought we were purchasing. After 24 hours they haven’t grown in size very much like the description states.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for my 3 yo.
customer_reviews.text: These are so cool! My 3yo daughter kept checking them throughout the day and would get so excited as they got bigger. Lots of fun for her to play with. They are slippery and break up if squeezed but held up when dropped or from her playing with them. I filled up her water table with them and still have 2/3 of the package left. Only negative is it does not say non toxic anywhere on the packaging. It does on the website though you just have to read a bit to find it. I included a photo to show the size difference before and after. This is a very small portion of what just one tablespoon made.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Look for another brand
customer_reviews.text: What is advertised and what we receive is 2 different things. The actual colors when put in water a very translucent and not very colorful as you can see in the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Steele

customer_reviews.title: Amazing beads
customer_reviews.text: These beads are amazing, I use them for vases, can't believe how they grow, you only need a tablespoon per gallon of water, I poured too many beads in the water, omg, had so many.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Pagano

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: ...... these are so awesome we have decided to fill a kiddie pool with them! 🤣 my kids are teenagers and toddlers. Great sensory fun was had by all, even the grown ups.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time my daughter used these water beads, and she absolutely loved them! I allowed them to soak for a little over 24 hours and they grew a good amount. Like the size of a marble. They were a little more opaque than I expected when they finally grew in size, but they did the job. There were also white and black beads included in the pack that wasn’t shown in the pictures. I will definitely be repurchasing them again!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great winter water table sensory play
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these beads. Great sensory play and I would order from this company again. The bag was deceivingly small but you only need one TBSP for a full tub of fun. After the first day or two they break much easier. This is a great indoor water table activity for the winter. I watch my 2 year old and pets very closely to make sure they don’t eat them more due to a choking hazard due to the nature of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna M Bevan

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun But Easily Broken
customer_reviews.text: These beads are great fun for my kids. However, they break very easy. Most of the them do not get very big and if they get too big they break. The breaking is really the deal breaker for me. It takes forever to find and pick up the tiny pieces when it gets squished or pops. If you have kids that don't really grasp the concept of handling something gently this isn't the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Kettledon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get very large but still fun
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions and set in proper amount of water for 24 hours but they didn’t get as large as we expected. But they were still fun and the kids enjoyed them.
customer_reviews.author: karina

customer_reviews.title: Super Cool!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I followed the directions and used a tablespoon full of orbeez with a gallon of water! The amount you get is unbelievable! These tiny little things burst into a huge bowl full of fun over night! I love these, my daughter loves these and we are having a blast!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Chowaniec

customer_reviews.title: Package was not fully sealed...a mess
customer_reviews.text: This product came in the mail and the seal on the package was not finished. Inside my amazon bag there were loose beads. Some spilled out upon opening the bag it was shipped it. Directions were easy to follow and my daughter enjoyed them (18 months) However, I was disappointed in quality of packaging and beads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what’s pictured
customer_reviews.text: They listed these as the larger water balls and they turned out to be the normal small size. My son was very disappointed. And I’m upset. I hate these types of misleading listings.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun, adorable beads
customer_reviews.text: These are really adorable and awesome to play with. My son is in love with it. I just left 1tbsp of beads in water for about 15 hours, we were aiming at leaving them for 24hrs as per the instructions. We just got impatient. No slime, soft to touch. loads of fun play time and we just barely scratched the top of the packet. I wish the beads were a bit more bright.
customer_reviews.author: Psach

customer_reviews.title: These are really fun for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: These are really fun for toddlers, BUT they are so messy hard to clean up and my son got them all over the house and deck was a big pain to clean up. Do not put in kids water table.
customer_reviews.author: R. Falla

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my kid to play. The beads grew to full size within 3-4hrs as against 24 hrs mentioned in the details. My kid loved playing with it..
customer_reviews.author: Pawan

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kids with sensory issues
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely LOVED these beads! He has high functioning autism with sensory issues. He enjoys watching them grow, as well as playing with them. We put a small amount into a balloon with some water to make our own sensory "squishy" And to be honest, my husband and I love playing with them too! Just a warning, they bounce and can get everywhere! The plus is they shrink back down and can be used over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot and a little all at once
customer_reviews.text: So, these looked nothing like the size of the picture after soaking. I used them for an event. The kids loved them, but I had to throw most of them out. Didn't realize there were so many.
customer_reviews.author: April Y.

customer_reviews.title: Did not expand with soaking
customer_reviews.text: I must have gotten a defective batch, because they have been soaking for three days, and they are still very small - not marble size like the photo.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomerToday

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 1 1/2 year old
customer_reviews.text: A little goes a long way! We put some in my 1 1/2 year olds water table and he loved them. They are great for sensory. They feel somewhat slippery and gelatin-like. They bounce kind of like a bouncy ball when thrown. We just used them for the first time yesterday so I’m not sure how long they last yet. Today’s day 2 and they are still all there.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Fetzer

customer_reviews.title: Tiny bag for the price paid. Not large beads at all
customer_reviews.text: The price paid is not worth the quantity. Also, these are standard size, not large. The only good feature is that it does have purple and green.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R

customer_reviews.title: Product isn't as advertised
customer_reviews.text: These sat in the correct amount of water for over 24 hours and never reached the size advertised. They stayed small and only absorbed maybe half the water, and also were breaking all over in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Filled them 2 months ago and put in a ziplock back and they are still good and have not gotten gross
customer_reviews.text: Works just as they should.They stay filled for a long time. Filled them 2 months ago and put in a ziplock back and they are still good and have not gotten gross. The colors are great!
customer_reviews.author: robTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great activity for kids
customer_reviews.text: Kids loved them. Balls didn’t get quite as big as I thought they might (slightly smaller than marbles) but the kids don’t care!
customer_reviews.author: Dan h.

customer_reviews.title: great sensory toy
customer_reviews.text: These beads have provided hours of entertainment, and I way to draw a preschooler away from the TV. She found out that if she squeezes the beads, they will crumble. This is not too much of an issue because I bought them to have fun and so that goal is met. And for the price, it is reasonable just to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other water beads, these ones didn't smash into pieces as easy. Highly recommend for kids of all ages. My 15 month old and 3.5 year old loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Vara

customer_reviews.title: Very Good for a Child with Autism (special needs)
customer_reviews.text: Very good for a child with Autism. My son loves them!! I got my son to talk a lot about them; colors, how they feel, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Verana Stark

customer_reviews.title: Very Important & Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandson and this helps him calm down. When we went to restaurants we just placed some in a zip lock bag and it kept him calm and occupied in the restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnie

customer_reviews.title: water beads
customer_reviews.text: These are lots of fun, and what looks like a small package actually lasts a very long time. They get as big and sometimes bigger than pictured if you let them...you just need to leave them in distilled water for a while. The kids have a blast checking on them to see how big they've gotten while they're 'growing' and playing with them. we've also found that they bounce when you throw them. (outside, of course!) We really enjoy playing with them.
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Great product but not the size advertised
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying these have been a lot of fun and we've had no issues with disintegration. However, they are not marble sized, they are closer to very large peas. My son kept asking me when they would be as big as marbles, sadly that never happened. Still a good deal and a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Normal

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly medium sized H2O beads!!
customer_reviews.text: Most amazing thing ever. I will continue to buy this product. They are a little tougher than the average waterbeads and they do get bigger. These pictures are two hours in the water and they are still getting bigger!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: got these for the kids, love them. Perfect size and good quality! Would reorder whenever I actually run out
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

product_meta.title: Rainbow Water Beads for Kids Non Toxic - Water Table Toy - Sensory Toys for Toddlers 3-4 - Educational Therapy Toy - 20,000 Colorful Gel Beads
feature_bullets: TACTILE TOY: Calming for a child who is autistic, special needs or has a sensory processing disorder
JUST ADD WATER: The beads arrive small but grow big once put in a jar of distilled water overnight
MAKES LEARNING FUN: Use the bead ball game to teach children colors, counting and fine motor skills
SAFE AND REUSABLE: Made of non-toxic polymer, beads can be dehydrated to return to the original size
ASSORTED COLORS: Our colorful magic water balls will capture children’s attention and encourage play

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,500 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
